meanings.definition: To become less rigid or inflexible.
meanings.sent1: Over time, the old leather belt was unstiffening and losing its shape.
meanings.sent2: The rules at the office were slowly unstiffening, allowing for more creativity.
meanings.sent3: The tree branches were unstiffening in the wind, swaying gracefully.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was unstiffening, opening up to new possibilities.
meanings.sent5: The ice was unstiffening under the warm sun, turning into water.
